isis.stitle: GENERAL INSTRUMENT ELECTRONIC PROGRAMMABLE SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER - TEST 2 - B+ VOLTAGE AND GROUND TEST

svcproc.title: TEST 2 - B+ VOLTAGE AND GROUND TEST

note.para: To perform TEST 1 or 2 with Caterpillar 3406B engine with PEEC and Kysor engine shutdown, the power to the speedometer/tachometer unit comes through the Run Relay when the run relay is activated by starting the engine. To perform TEST 1 or 2, which require "key switch ON" in this section without running the engine, install a jumper wire connecting the number 1 and number 3 terminals of the Kysor control module. BE SURE TO REMOVE THE JUMPER BEFORE STARTING THE ENGINE.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 9 for this test.

figure.caption: Using Voltmeter To Check B+ Battery Voltage And Ground Circuit

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. INSTRUMENT PANEL GROUND A. VEHICLE HARNESS SPEEDOMETER CONNECTOR B. CIRCUIT 47 (B+ VOLTAGE) (CIR 97P WITH CAT 3406 W/PEEC) C. CIRCUIT 11AG OR 47 G (GROUND CIRCUIT)(CIR 97 GG WITH CAT 3406 W/ PEEC

svcproc.para: This test should be run when NEITHER the speedometer or tachometer pointer moves (dead) during TEST 1. The speedometer, tachometer and odometer rely on a single B+ voltage source and a single ground circuit. If either is defective the speedometer/tachometer unit will not function.

item.para: Turn the key switch to the OFF position.
This test requires the use of a DC voltmeter.
This system operates ONLY with 12 volts DC. DO NOT CONNECT TO A 24 VOLT SUPPLY.

step1.para: Remove speedometer/tachometer unit from instrument panel (see REMOVE AND INSTALL).
Disconnect instrument panel harness from all speedometer/tachometer unit connectors.

Connect (+) voltmeter lead to vehicle instrument panel harness speedometer connector at B+ feed, circuit 47 or 97P. Connect (-) meter lead to good vehicle ground. Turn switch key to ON position. Meter should read 12-13 volts.

If no voltage or low voltage is indicated, check the feed circuit for open condition or loose connection between the speedometer connection and the key switch. Correct condition and retest. Refer to circuit diagrams included in this section. Also verify batteries are fully charged.

When B+ voltage is verified, perform the ground circuit test as follows. Connect (+) meter lead to vehicle instrument panel harness speedometer connector at B+ feed, circuit 47. Connect (-) meter lead to speedometer/tachometer unit ground circuit 11AG (96/9700) or 47-G (93/9400) or 97-GG (CAT 3406B W/PEEC) of instrument panel harness connector. Turn switch key to ON position. Voltage should read 12-13 volts.
If no voltage or low voltage is indicated, check ground circuit 11AG or 47-G or 97-GG for open condition or loose connections. Correct condition and retest. Refer to circuit diagrams in this section.
If steps 3 and 4 show that the B+ circuits and the ground circuits are good, assure that the instrument panel harness speedometer connection to the speedometer/tachometer unit is good.
If steps 3, 4, and 5 of TEST 2 show that the B+ feed and ground circuits are good and the connection to the speedometer/tachometer unit is good go to TEST 7.
